intro: Chaetanthera australis, commonly known as the Australian sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and the flowers are often white or pale blue in color. It plays a role in local ecosystems and has been used traditionally by Indigenous communities.
